website_summaries.verdict: While these snowshoes are capable of trudging through deep snow, they lack the quality and build to live up to their all-terrain description.
pros: Designed for comfort and reliable flotation, as the decks and tubing are made of lightweight materials
Trekking poles are included for added stability while navigating terrain
cons: The durability of the bindings is questionable because they are made of flimsy plastic, plus they are difficult to adjust
Breakage of various components is common

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for leisurely (easy to medium activities). Not for serious backcountry enthusiasts (hard to difficult activities).
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these snowshoes for $54.00-a price you can't really beat. The first time I used these snowshoes, I trekked 12 miles (ish) in deep, wet snow and camped on the top of a mountain. The snowshoes held up nicely. They are easy on and off even with cold, numb hands. I wouldn't recommend them for serious backcountry enthusiasts...I'm not sure how much abuse they will take, but for leisurely snowshoeing, I say it's a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Snow Bunny Approved...
customer_reviews.text: ...Bought a set for both me and my wife. These were sized for my wife; a first time snowshoer. She had zero problems and enjoyed using them.
customer_reviews.author: Wyo

customer_reviews.title: ... snowshoes more than the weight - these shoes are great for blazing trails in really deep powder
customer_reviews.text: I would suggest thinking about the use of the snowshoes more than the weight - these shoes are great for blazing trails in really deep powder, but don't expect to enjoy them on paths or areas that people have already groomed a trail. at that point, you are likely to slide down the hills because there's at least 12 inches of "sled" attached to your foot! A friend borrowed these and went off on her own trail through untouched forest and loved them.
customer_reviews.author: alexis

customer_reviews.title: great customer service, fun in the snow
customer_reviews.text: We purchased three pairs, my husband, myself and my child. The small pair, the little clip came undone and we could not fix it, so it would not latch. I reached out to customer service (directly, not through amazon) and they sent me a new pair, they were so great. We love our shoes, I don't know what I'd compare them to-this is the first pair we have owned. Its a great workout and fun in the snow. They fit with your own boot, which is nice. My heel came loose but with a little practice on how to get them to fit, three great. Id recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey Kerchansky

customer_reviews.title: Super Excited to use these
customer_reviews.text: I received my snow shoes as a Christmas gift and luckily, we traveled to snowy terrain for the holidays. I was able to use them there and had a blast. Now I am just waiting for our atypically mild winter to give way to the normal many feet of snow here at home so I can enjoy them more. Easy to use, lightweight, easy to transport ... and they look cute.
customer_reviews.author: CDG

customer_reviews.title: broken
customer_reviews.text: first try this winter they broke. In multiple ways. my wife had parts of hers also perform poorly. I wish I could have my money back but it appears they is no option to return. The company must not stand by this product.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B Wirch

customer_reviews.title: I thought they ware very good. I hesitated before purchasing because of some bad ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought they ware very good. I hesitated before purchasing because of some bad reviews. Based on the reviews I carefully read how to install the shoes over my boots to get a good fit and I plan to store the shoes in dry, dark location to help prevent the straps from breaking due to exposure to the elements.
customer_reviews.author: brian t cody

customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for the common man, weekend warrior. Decent flotation but didn't expect to break trail for long. They're also pretty noisy at first due to the plastic like material they're made from. 3.5/5
customer_reviews.author: Brian B.

customer_reviews.title: Not such a great deal.
customer_reviews.text: The snowshoes are OK. I thought the bindings would be easy to disengage using the poles, but that is not the case. Not a problem. If the bindings hold up to continued use through several winters, I'll be satisfied. The poles on the other hand are junk. On one pole, the bottom section could not be locked into position. On the other pole, the upper section could not unlocked to enable adjustment. Fortunately, my husband as able to disassemble the poles and somehow get them to work after reassembly. Next time I'll go to a sporting goods store. Then when I go to use the purchased item, I'll know they will work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great if you only want a half dozen uses.
customer_reviews.text: My "heavy duty" crampons flattened out after about 5 uses I noticed my front crampons were completely flat causing them to break the rest of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Letalien

customer_reviews.title: this has been really good snow shoes for us considering the amount of times ...
customer_reviews.text: this has been really good snow shoes for us considering the amount of times that we go snowshoeing. When we rented some a couple years ago I think the others were a little bit better quality as far as the feel and sturdiness of them. But these have been exactly what we need for the amount of time that we go snowshoeing. It's just a hobby something we do occasionally on the side. If we were going to be heavy duty get into snowshoeing, I probably would have someone shop with me and find something that was perfect for my stride and step and weight.
customer_reviews.author: L. Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for the price. I have used them on flat, rolling, and steep terrain (Paradise on Mt. Rainier and upper slopes of Mt. St. Helen's). The anchor system is compatible with any shoe/boot I have used and they are very easy to put on and take off. The anti-shock walking sticks are great and useful any time of the year.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Dean

customer_reviews.title: Great snowshoe for non-experts.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these snowshoes to go on a trip through yellowstone this winter. I ended up using them for about 10 miles on standard groomed paths as well as 4+ft deep powder. They performed excellent, and I was pleasantly surprised about the flotation and grip I was able to achieve. They are missing some nice features that more expensive snowshoes likely have, but they were very easy to use and performed great in many different situations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The snowshoes are easy to get on and off
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before I purchased these. This is my first time with snowshoes. Some of the reviews were negative, but I based my purchase on how many positive views there were. The snowshoes are easy to get on and off. Although, I had issues with tightening the bindings/buckle..But it was me that was the problem..I asked questions here on Amazon and got a couple of really good answers that helped me figure this out. They are a great workout and just downright fun to walk through the snow with. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: filately

customer_reviews.title: Seems good
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good product. Haven’t had enough snow yet to really try them out. The bag does seem a bit small so to put the shoes in the spikes rub against the side and could rip the bag. It could be a bit bigger so the shoes could be put in so the spikes are facing each other in the middle of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gaurin

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it buy new not used
customer_reviews.text: We bought these used from here and one of the poles is broken at the end with no snow or dirty adaptors and the left snowshoe clip kept coming undone clearly broken. I’m bummed because I read such amazing reviews about this brand
customer_reviews.author: Erin LaRosa

customer_reviews.title: Poor Product, Poor Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: VERY FIRST TIME I used the rivot that holds the binding on broke... I'm out with friends in a forest preserve and there I sit, I don't even get to go with them. Because our first snow was 32 days after I bought them I couldn't return them to Amazon and I can't get anyone at Alps to call me / email me back to have them warranty them. VERY DISAPPOINTED in PRODUCT AND COMPANY! In the meantime I bought Red Feathers so I could enjoy my winter and they work perfect! Spend the money, get a better product and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: D Beaver

customer_reviews.title: Only used once!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used these shoes once but liked them when I did use them! Look forward to using them more this winter! I had no difficulty when using these shoes and worked well for what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: BluesLover

customer_reviews.title: Not As Advertised. No Poles.
customer_reviews.text: Box came with shoes, case and NO poles. Not as advertised. Amazon compensated and they were great.
customer_reviews.author: cleanps

customer_reviews.title: Good for almost one whole outing
customer_reviews.text: After an intial ~5 mile hike alternating between deep snow and hardpack these are basically ruined. On hardpack or icier patches the spikes bent flat turning the snowshoe into a tiny sled for one foot, causing me to forgo the snowshoe altogether for safety concerns as I crossed icy patches. The ratcheting system to tighten the straps is so cheaply made it barely works. The poles were fine. I guess it's about what you'd expect from such a cheap pair of snowshoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jive

customer_reviews.title: Effective for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bindings won't hold up to heavy use and can break at the straps overtime. It is difficult to find replacement bindings if they break. Overall effective product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Megan K.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this garbage.
customer_reviews.text: They broke within the first 5 minutes of me using them for the first time. Most expensive 5 minutes I've ever spent $100 on. Do not buy this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: HutCHU

customer_reviews.title: Used in 33” of snow
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for winter storm Evelyn where we got 33” of snow. Unfortunatly one of them was broken and my foot kept sliding out. The only reason I gave it 4 stars was because they were broken and I really needed to be able to use them. In all they worked great besides being broken.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Great value
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a christmas present for my son and daughter in law. They love them and love the quality and the they come with a carry case
customer_reviews.author: terri bolotas

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Excellent Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: These are a great price point for beginners. I purchased them at the end offset season and didn’t get to use them until a couple weeks ago. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality. I lost one of the baskets on my poles while on my second trek. Bummed, I wrote the seller requesting to purchase a replacement. They sent me a new set of poles free of charge!
customer_reviews.author: staudsa

customer_reviews.title: NOT deep powder arctic units. Short straps.
customer_reviews.text: USELESS in deep powder. Packed trails only. Straps too short. Will not fit on real Arctic boots. Nice ice cleats thou.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: Snowshoes work well. The poles are a different story. We had the baskets and tips fall off one set of poles on the very first use!
customer_reviews.author: margaret youdall

customer_reviews.title: Only had wood and sinew shoes before.
customer_reviews.text: My first “modern” pair of snowshoes and I can’t believe I waited this long. The easy on and off, the light weight, they grip, and the amazing float on the snow are all game changers for me. I even like the poles. These will see a lot more use next season for sure!
customer_reviews.author: michael bagley

customer_reviews.title: Great Snowshoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these snowshoes! I have to say that they are much different..in a good way..then the ones I had while stationed in Alaska. Those were more like tennis rackets. :) These are easy to clip on, and no matter how cold it is, or how much snow, the clasp easily opens.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn J. Hooton

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good product
customer_reviews.text: No, these aren't the highest quality, but if you don't want to spend a lot of money & you're not planning to use them every day, then these are perfect. I only strap them on a few times in the winter, so they've been great for 2 winters now. The straps can be tricky especially if it's cold & you're wearing gloves, etc... that's probably my only complaint, but as I don't know much about snowshoes, that may be typical of any that you buy. All in all, happy with this product
customer_reviews.author: TLF

customer_reviews.title: WOW what a great company!
customer_reviews.text: First of all these snowshoes work great and make our treking effortless but even more impressive is the seller. We recieved the snowshoes with a damaged binder and within a couple days the company had a new shoe at our door. This is exactly what customer service should look like. The shoes allow me to trevail deep and shallow snow with far less effort and am now much more excited about longer hikes, what a difference, it really is like walking on top of the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Florsheim

customer_reviews.title: Nah
customer_reviews.text: Buckles stripped out very quickly. But it's cheap and it got me up the mountain.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I got this to give to someone for a Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.text: This set is a Christmas gift so I can't really say if it's great, good, or just ok. I can say it looks very nice and the recipient will be very surprised and that she will like the color!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon reader

customer_reviews.title: My mom loves hers!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my mother for her daily walks in the woods with the dogs. She doesn't know why she didn't get a pair years ago!! Makes walking in the snow significantly easier! I think they are the best birthday gift I've ever gotten her! Easy on and off too!
customer_reviews.author: live2read

customer_reviews.title: Mailing is cheap, if you receive with prime.
customer_reviews.text: The product was fine. The plastic clip on the left heel shoe was bent. Which means the left snow shoe will not stay on my foot. I will replace it myself. The hand snow balances do not stay together they loosen as you walk. If you can handle the aggravation, they are cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod

customer_reviews.title: Great snowshoes!
customer_reviews.text: I like these. I haven’t figured out the poles yet, but I have only used them once. I really love snowshoeing.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Get around in the snow.
customer_reviews.text: A great snowshoe package. The quick attach/release bindings work easily and conform to different size boots without compromising their fit and usability. The poles expand and contract easily and maintain their settings. The carrying bag was an unexpected bonus and provides added utility. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J. Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Have not used a lot, but work well without any breakdowns yet. Would like them to be a little wider.
customer_reviews.author: wilb3

customer_reviews.title: No poles
customer_reviews.text: Looked like great snowshoes but had to return because the poles weren't included.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good snowshoes: very sturdy and no defects.
customer_reviews.text: Used them for two seasons now. The shoes are very sturdy and have no defects. The poles are poorly designed and tend to collapse when any significant force is applied with them (such as you would use to stand back up or to climb a steep incline). Shoes, I'd give 5/5 stars; and poles, 3/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ravenlok

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional customer service
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my husband and he loves them. They work great taking our dogs out on a walk to enjoy the snow. We had an issue with one of the poles and the service we received was exceptional! They emailed me back right away and took care of it. Don't hesitate to order these!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Nice snow shoes good value
customer_reviews.text: The straps that go over the toes are to small if you wear insulated boots. Which they are used for snow. Not very happy about that.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Kuenzel

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking!
customer_reviews.text: Hello, the first time I used the snow shoes on my vacation to Newfoundland they broke! I am so bummed is there anythihg I can do to have them fixed or get a replacement? Please let me know. Other than that they are great! Very easy to use and perfect for hiking in the snow. I love them. I ordered 2 pairs for my husband and I. His worked perfect too. Aside from the broken buckel the are very nicely made and durable. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Kopish

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I rely heavily on reviews, but very rarely do I write a review. However, I was so pleasantly surprised by this product I have to leave a review. This is my first pair of snowshoes. I’m 5’7 140 pounds. For the price I was a bit skeptical, but they worked awesome! Did not use the poles yet, and the zipper is a bit flimsy on the bag, but I am really happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: sid hemminger

customer_reviews.title: Good quality snowshoes at a low price
customer_reviews.text: I tried these out for the first time last weekend and had a blast. Lightweight yet got me through some fairly deep snow. The only issue I had was that one of the top straps came loose a few times but nothing I couldnt fix. I highly recommend these snowshoes, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Teri Folkner

customer_reviews.title: so good. The straps and mechanisms are very easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. The straps and mechanisms are very easy to use. Easily put on and adjusted the strap - easily pull to release. I have to wear them some more to give a better review, but so far I am impressed with the fitting and straps.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't stay on my feet. Plastic of the straps is too hard, doesn't give. Returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: CHECK EVERYTHING!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had the opportunity to really use them... but I got the poles out the other day to do some trail work and found that one the poles doesn’t lock... now I have to buy another set of poles.... needless to say I’m more than a little annoyed
customer_reviews.author: superjester

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes, defective poles
customer_reviews.text: The snowshoes worked great. Unfortunately, the telescoping poles were defective. The first pole never made it on the trail, it slipped out beyond the word "stop" and wouldn't go back together no matter how many different ways we tried. The second pole lost the end cap and basket within the first few few of walking. After a five mile hike, it fell apart into two pieces despite being tightened into place. Disappointed with the quality of the poles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.  I should have stayed with Tubbs.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in these snowshoes & poles. Bindings don’t hold, they’re noisy when I walk, and the poles broke the first time I used them.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke the F

customer_reviews.title: Clasp Broke
customer_reviews.text: The snowshoes work great for staying above the snow and being lightweight, however the claps to keep shoes in broke after the second use. We bought two pairs and both had the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Maxx108

customer_reviews.title: No heel straps on 14" and 17" snowshoes!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these snowshoes for our grandchildren, and they ruined our outing. Neither sets of snowshoes had heel straps and they simply fell off when they tried to walk. Don't understand why they would be made that way. Returned them promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Good light weight snow shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for our needs. We are newbies to snowshoeing . Found these easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought these snowshoes for my daughter-in-law for Christmas, but the second time out, the mid-foot buckle broke. The ratchet strap is poorly made so, although she was able to keep walking with the front and back straps and the platform of the snowshoe functioned just fine, we decided to return them for a refund. After some initial confusion with the seller (it took several email exchanges), we were able to return them for a full refund. The snowshoes are very inexpensive and the quality is consistent with the price.
customer_reviews.author: Active VT Woman

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my wife, she's never used snowshoes before. So far she's really enjoying them. Seem to be holding up well after a few uses. We had to remove the rubber piece off the heel strap because she has small feet... But they work well for a beginner. Only time will tell on durability.
customer_reviews.author: KMS

customer_reviews.title: Should have rented snowshoes.
customer_reviews.text: Shoes arrived Dec 5, plastic heel connector snap broke Dec 8 as I put them on the first time. Had to use a shoe lace to tie pieces together while everyone waited for me. One of the antishock poles got lose and the bottom section came out. Had to back track to find it but the anitshock mechanism bent which took a bit of unbending to stick the section back into the middle section. Can't say the metal clips worked well but they held. Could have rented better snowshoes for $12.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Fee

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these!!
customer_reviews.text: These snowshoes are obviously made with very cheap materials. When we got to the trailhead and started to put them on, we noticed this right away. The straps are made of cheap, inflexible plastic and the clips feel like they could break at any minute. My hushand's toe strap broke before we could even start snowshoeing. My ankle strap didn't want to click into place because the clips are so cheap. I would not recommend purchasing these. We completely wasted our money. We will spend a little bit extra next time to get a better quality product.
customer_reviews.author: ecrain

customer_reviews.title: ahhhhmazing customer service
customer_reviews.text: My fiance and I each got a pair of these to use up north. We got them kind of last minute and didn't expect to have them in time, but they came the day before we left. Unfortunately the back strap of one of them broke after the second time using them. I emailed the company, sent pictures and they sent a brand new pair right away! Amazing customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Eryn4705

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes crummy poles
customer_reviews.text: Snowshoes are good but poles don't hold their height no matter how tight I get the adjustment . I suggest buying poles separately
customer_reviews.author: JohnL

customer_reviews.title: Great snow shoes for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I had never snow shoed before so I thought I would start off with some relatively inexpensive equipment. This set has been great. I have gone out several times and they are pretty easy to get on and off. You do sometimes have to tighten the straps up after a little while, but also could be from the boots I was wearing.
customer_reviews.author: Lena A. Burckhardt

customer_reviews.title: These snowshoes work!!
customer_reviews.text: Both of these items have lived up to expectation! They are very light, easy to attach, and did the job of providing us with a great walk in the 6' deep snow of the Sierra Nevada Mountains. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Love these! I'm 5'5" and 130lbs and they fit ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I'm 5'5" and 130lbs and they fit perfect. Looking forward to using them when winter comes around again
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: White not black disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Shoes look good but I ordered black and got white really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Watts

customer_reviews.title: Snowshoes
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband. Very good quality and they came with a nice bag for storing.
customer_reviews.author: jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: They are easy to strap on, and have crampons everywhere, so no sliding even on ice or hills. But the bindings are plastic, so not sure how long those will last, and they are loud across the ice. If you have any intentions of being sneaky, these are not the shoes for you.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Latches dont work
customer_reviews.text: The latch mechanism is poorly designed. Hard to strap on and close to impossible to loosen. If you are thinking of latching in and out like a snow boot, forget it.
customer_reviews.author: Nir

customer_reviews.title: So far So good
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for cheap way into snowshowing this seems to be a good ticket to ride! Strapped them on...oops rear heel straps assembled backwards..disassembled the straps and redid them. For the price I guess you need to expect those things. Overall they work well, they are very similar to the "yukon charlie" brand I had gotten a couple years ago but not as nice. Begginer level price and quality...I am rough on my stuff so I abused them first day out on a back country hike, in the creek over logs thru the thicket and jumping off stuff....well they held up without any breaks....
customer_reviews.author: Garrett NY

customer_reviews.title: Great and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great price! Shopped around and these were the best priced and I have been very pleased with them. Poles stay at the length you want and shoes don't loosen as you use them.
customer_reviews.author: GirlLady

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I don't use these as often as I should (usually just to snowshoe to work if we get heavy snowfall) but they're a lot of fun when I do. My only complaint is that they can be difficult to tighten or release--sometimes the button catches and just won't let go.
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey R.

customer_reviews.title: Would be a good product if it didn't have cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: On my second use, an adjustment buckle broke and I had to tie the piece that goes around the ankle off to the frame. Gave it a 2 star because it was very annoying to have to keep tightening the strap after the buckle broke.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: They are ok, but should be better
customer_reviews.text: Uses some cheap material for the bindings. Plastic buckles and cold do not work well. The back strap buckle busted during our second time out. Luckily we were not too far from the trail head.
customer_reviews.author: Peter T

customer_reviews.title: not reliable snowshoes
customer_reviews.text: Used these snowshoes ones and the cleats did not hold up. it flattened out before I was able to complete the hike. hike was only about 3 miles round trip.
customer_reviews.author: Basil Nwokolo

customer_reviews.title: Treking in the snow
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for casual, recreational treking. Were everything they were advertised as bieing. As I've begun to learn more about the product family, the higher end brands are engineered for longer life under heavier use levels and convienence amenities of bindings and poles are improved. I would recomend to a friend for simillar applications.
customer_reviews.author: over 40

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great snowshoes at a great price. Came with telescoping trekking poles and carrying case. These worked great and were easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Holder

customer_reviews.title: Product worked as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Snow shoes were easy to use right out of the box. Both my wife and I enjoyed using them and can't wait for our next outing.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great Snowshoes
customer_reviews.text: Great snowshoes! Only problem is they throw snow up as I walk so my snow pants get wet. Other than that they are great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Sandee

customer_reviews.title: First pair-Great beginner snow shoes
customer_reviews.text: For the price these are great snow shoes. I did purchase a size bigger then I thought I would need. I have been using the poles for both snow shoeing and hiking and they have been great. Price is worth the hiking poles alone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They were not easy to be used.
customer_reviews.text: I like them because they are light and don’t like them because it straps on the back was loos and couldn’t support my boots.
customer_reviews.author: Afsaneh

customer_reviews.title: Still not the pictured item, and two poles unussable
customer_reviews.text: The shoes shipped white with no poles. After going through many hoops, I received a return tag, and the new shipment still had white shoes,but they included the poles. One pole came without an end cap, and one pole would not tighten to adjust in height,which of course we did not find out until we were up on the mountain. The straps are hard plastic, not flexible rubber, and were very hard to tighten and loosen. They were OK for the price, but I still need to get the replacement poles. We will definitely buy another product from another reatiler.
customer_reviews.author: karen lea tallman

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The snowshoes are light and easy to use. The bindings are easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Storage bag is not good quality
customer_reviews.text: I think the snowshoes and poles are OK. My son hasn't used them yet. The storage bag was already torn. Don't know if it came that way or if it tore when pulling it out of the box. Will have to purchase another storage bag.
customer_reviews.author: G. Elder

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I used these alot this last winter. We can go about anywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Candi Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: My daughter received a duplicate of these snowshoes and has gone out with a friend several times already since her friends don't all have snowshoes and she doesn't like going alone. She loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Music Mama

customer_reviews.title: Great snowshoes
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried them yet, but I husband and brought two last year. They worked great. I just ordered the wrong size for me and reordered this year.
customer_reviews.author: Roselily

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at Christmas time for my daughter-in-law. She has enjoyed them a lot during the snowy season and loves being able to get out and snow shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can't go wrong.....they are light and easy to put on and take off! The bag they came is is very cheaply made but I love the snow shoes!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Took these out for the first time today. We were beginners at snowshoeing and these were very easy to set up and use. Held up well in deep snow. The bindings held fast with almost 2 hours of use. Perfect for what we needed. Cannot comment on longevity as have had less than 1 month.
customer_reviews.author: jmarie2839

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and fun times to be had!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these! Now that we have more than enough snow he has been using them all over the property.
customer_reviews.author: ARichey

customer_reviews.title: Did the job after modification
customer_reviews.text: First shipment contained faulty shoe. Seller sent a replacement but the replacement was not a match. Appeared to be a woman's shoe instead of men's and wasnt even same color.. Ended up taking straps off original shoe and modifying replacement to make it fit. Other than that, a pretty functional shoe.
customer_reviews.author: David Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: They are great!!! Bought them for my daughter and she loves them. Great value and great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Dexter T.

customer_reviews.title: Snow bound no more!
customer_reviews.text: very sturdy, easy to use after getting used to them. came with poles which is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Jmori

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to strap on and get around in. for a smaller snowshoe they hold you up fairly well in the snow but in the waist high snow of the north shore of lake superior they do sink up past your knee
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Michael Vogel

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Set
customer_reviews.text: Good starter set. Crampons will deform on rocky terrain within 5 to 10 miles of use carrying 225 lbs. The trekking poles are sturdy. I like the antishock feature.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These snowshoes were a life saver on a recent hiking trip to the UP.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these snowshoes they are amazing!!! Work well in deep snow and on groomed trails. 👍🏿
customer_reviews.author: tia amich

customer_reviews.title: Cool gadget
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for recreational snow shoeing, did some running in them and they held up fine, one of the poles failed, but was quickly replaced free of charge!
customer_reviews.author: dei3639

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes, good price. Worth the money, good grip, durable construction, poles are a little flimsy, so be aware of that.
customer_reviews.author: REHac

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome so easy to use now I can walk anywhere on my 14 acres in Alaska !
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice showshoes for my light use and great price included the poles
customer_reviews.author: jsilvia

customer_reviews.title: Average product package
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this outfit one time so far. the snowshoes worked well, but the poles are obviously not the best. One pole collapsed on the first try. I decided to get this package deal to see if I would enjoy snowshoeing in my area. if I get good results from the snowshoes, I will probably upgrade to a better product in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Bomboy

product_meta.title: ALPS Adult All Terrian Snowshoes Set for Men,Women,Youth with Trekking Poles,Carrying Tote Bag14 /17" / 22"/25"/27"/30"
feature_bullets: 14" Size For user weights from 30-60 lbs ,17" size for user weights from 60-80 lbs, 19" size for user weights from 80-120 lbs,22 " - Size For user weights from 80-150 lbs, 25" -Size For user weights from 120-180 lbs, 27 " Size For user weights from 160-220 lbs,30" Size For user weights from 180-250 lbs,
The snowshoes frames are made of lightweight and strong aluminum tubing and the decks are made of UV resistant durable, lightweight polyethylene material.
Easy to use ratchet bindings and heel straps with quick release buckles.
Extreme heavy duty aluminum crampons, provide strong tractions.
